channel.title: git on hg8's Notes
channel.description: Recent content in git on hg8's Notes

item.title: Bitlab - HackTheBox
item.description: Bitlab box was an interesting box, user part was typical real-life scenario (actually meet this scenario during a pentest) while the root part was my first time Reverse Engineering. First we add the box ip to our hosts file and let's start! $ echo "10.10.10.114 bitlab.htb" >> /etc/hosts User flag. Let's start with the classic nmap scan: nmap -sV -sT -sC bitlab.htb Starting Nmap 7.80 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2019-10-26 02:00 CEST PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION 22/tcp open ssh OpenSSH 7.

item.title: Craft - HackTheBox
item.description: Craft was a not so straight forward box, mainly based on little configuration mistakes rather than exploits. Which makes it more interesting in my opinion. I learned a few tricks on this one. First thing first, let's add the box IP to the hosts file: $ echo "10.10.10.110 craft.htb" >> /etc/hosts and let's start! User Flag Recon Let's start with the classic nmap scan: $ nmap -sV -sT -sC craft.htb Starting Nmap 7.
